channel.title: Homes on Jose Alquicira Hernandez
channel.description: Recent content in Homes on Jose Alquicira Hernandez

item.description: Biography Hello! I’m a PhD student at the Garvan-Weizmann Center for Cellular Genomics supervised by Joseph Powell. My research interests include Computational Biology, Human Genomics, and Cellular Genomics, particulary on understanding the genetic control of gene expression and its role in disease at a single cell resolution. In the first year of my PhD I developed a package called scPred to predict cell types at single cell resolution. You can see my paper here.

item.title: Teaching
item.description: Helper. Workshop: RNA-seq analysis in R. (2017). Organised by the COMBINE organisation Teacher. R/Bioconductor. (2016). Master in Biological Sciences. National Autonomous University of Mexico Teacher. Introduction to R. (2015). Center for Genomic Sciences. Computational Genomics Program. Teaching Assistant. Welcome to Bioinformatics. (2013 -2015). Undergraduate Program on Genomic Sciences. National Autonomous University of Mexico Teacher. Intensive Course on Bioinformatics. (2013). Autonomous University of the State of Morelos - Biology Department Teacher.
